creator: nhdphuong@yahoo.com
text:
I have a html file in which includes a movie file(unicode file name). 
When I run it through Apache on Windows, everything is OK.
But when I run it on Turbo Linux 10, I have a problem "It cannot recognize 
that movie file".
Apache version 2.0.xx does not support unicode file name ?

utf-8, yes!  unicode?  %unnnn hex format unicode is not valid by either
the RFC2616 nor the html spec.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
nhdphuong@yahoo.com
text:
(In reply to comment #1)
> utf-8, yes!  unicode?  %unnnn hex format unicode is not valid by either
> the RFC2616 nor the html spec.

Do you have any document or article talk about this problem ?
It can understand html file with unicode file name but cannot understand the 
movie file (unicode file) which is used in that html file. I must show about 
this in detail, so  I would like to read some document about this, do you get 
it ? Show me please.

creator: wrowe@apache.org
text:
Consult an appropriate peer-to-peer user list, bugzilla is strictly for reporting
bugs in the httpd server code.

creator: nhdphuong@yahoo.com
text:
(In reply to comment #3)
> Consult an appropriate peer-to-peer user list, bugzilla is strictly for 
reporting
> bugs in the httpd server code.

I'm sorry but I cannot find the correspondence report about this problem. 
Could you please show me more detail ....

creator: jorton@redhat.com
text: Please see http://httpd.apache.org/userslist.html for details of the users list.
